candidates.title: Retry on reset connections
candidates.body:
Many people have reported getting connection resets of the form:

`Hyper error: Connection reset by peer (os error 54)`

or

`Hyper error: Connection reset by peer (os error 104) (None)`

This catches that error and retries (once), which seems to fix it. Should have a deeper followup to figure out why this happens.

candidates.title: update some deps, add env_logger
candidates.body: Update some deps, and add env_logger to help debug in dependent libs

candidates.title: Add support for exec style auth
Add support for ranges (and other fixes)
candidates.body:
Primarily this adds support for selecting and operating on ranges of objects.

Lots of other cleanups too:
- use clickwriteln instead of embeded newlines
- add lots of new unit tests
- add a concept of `kobj` which will help encapsulate behavior of selected objects better
- many little bug fixes

candidates.title: Fixes for 0.4.2
candidates.body: Need to update rustyline version and fix an issue

candidates.title: Fix webpki errors for  IP SAN certs
candidates.body:
This PR uses a hack to support certs with IpAddress SANs.  This is what minikube uses, so it's important for click to support them.

This is pretty gross, but works.  We can remove this when webpki supports IpAddress SANs properly.

candidates.title: Update duct to 0.12, which is what duct_sh depends on
Rustyline 3.0
candidates.body:
This updates to the newest version of RustyLine.

This includes a number of things:
- Overhaul of the completion logic for the new api
- Adding completion for options for all commands
- ability to set the edit_mode and completion type and using those settings

candidates.title: Make config write atomic, and write it more often
candidates.body:
It sucks to loose your aliases because click was killed for some reason.  This PR makes it so that any time you add/remove and alias, or change context, the config file is written out.

It also makes it so writing the config is atomic (using the `atomicfile` crate), so it's safe to do this from multiple running instances of Click.

candidates.title: Use dirs crate
candidates.body: This is #80 with a tiny bit of cleanup

candidates.title: Hyper sync rustls
candidates.body: This is essentially #84, but with slightly less specific versions, and rebased to master

candidates.title: bump version of yaml-rust and serde_yaml
candidates.body:
While looking at #66 I found out there are now 3 crates marked as vulnerable by `cargo-audit` in click. These are `untrusted`, `serde_yaml` and `yaml-rust` (dependency of `serde_yaml`).

This PR updates `serde_yaml` to the latest version.

`untrusted` is going to be a bit harder to update as it's a dependency of `hyper` and `hyper-rustls`.
